name: Sixes Social Cricket (London Bridge)
short_title: Cricket batting cages + sports bar vibe (service can be inconsistent)
summary: Sixes Social Cricket combines cricket batting cages/simulators with a sports bar setting. Reviews suggest it’s a great idea and often a brilliant time—especially for corporate socials, birthdays and group nights—where the activity is the main event. The most common negatives relate to service/operations on busy slots, timekeeping/booking readiness, and food quality being fine but pricey. A smaller set of reviews raise cleanliness and toilet concerns.
what_diners_love: Cricket nets/simulators are genuinely fun, even for beginners
Great setup for group events, birthdays and work socials
Lots of seating and screens for watching sport
Lively, buzzy atmosphere that works well for parties
Several standout staff members are repeatedly praised by name
atmosphere_experience: A lively activity venue with a sports bar feel—busy, noisy and high-energy, especially during peak booking slots. Designed for groups and celebrations rather than quiet catch-ups.
good_to_know: Arrive early, especially for busy slots (check-in delays and queues reported)
Bookings may not always start on time during peak periods
Food is commonly described as average/pub-grub for the price
If sound/commentary matters to you, ask staff about audio policy before settling in
mixed_feedback: Service and operations issues are the most common complaint (slow bar service, being ignored on arrival, chaotic when busy)
Booking issues reported (waiting past slot time; one report of same-day cancellation)
Music can be too loud; comfort issues noted (heat, low commentary volume)
Pricing/value confusion reported (per-person charges, promo/discount frustrations)
Toilet cleanliness issues mentioned; a few reviews claim pests/rodents sightings
best_for: Cricket fans who want a sports bar vibe
top_tip: Treat this as an activity-first venue: arrive early, keep booking confirmation handy, and set food expectations to 'pub grub'. If it’s a special occasion, email ahead to reduce booking mix-up risk.
